results.title: Theodora
results.brief_description: Theodora, an oratorio in three parts, music by George Frideric Handel with Libretto by Thomas Morell, is a tale of virtuous love bound for tragic consequences in the name of Christian martyrdom during 4th century Roman occupied Antioch (Syria) under the reign of the Roman Emperor Diocletian. However, what is so different with this portrayal of Theodora is the way internationally renowned director Peter Sellars has set the story in modern day America including the final chilling scene of martyrdom being represented by Theodora and Didymus’s execution by lethal injection. The stark stage setting is evocative with its lighting and shadows and manages to create the desired moods of emotion and drama. A powerful performance by Dawn Upshaw as Theodora, strong and yet sensitive, and an equally excellent performance by David Daniels as Didymus. Supporting cast includes Frode Olsen (Valens), Richard Croft (Septimius), Lorraine Hunt (Irene) and Michael Hart-Davis (Messenger). Also features the Orchestra of the Age of Enlightenment conducted by William Christie, with musical direction by Andrew Davis and accompanied by the Glyndebourne Chorus (chorus master Christopher Moulds). This made for television production of “Theodora” was performed at the 1996 Glyndebourne Festival Opera. Sung in English with English subtitles.

results.title: Theobald faces the facts
results.creator_credit: Cal Dunn Studios, Joe Betzer and Cal Dunn
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon which presents facts that reveal the inaccuracy of mythical fancies concerning the effects of alcoholic beverages. The film technique used is designed for audience participation.

results.title: Then one year
results.brief_description:
Deals primarily with physiological changes in boys and girls at the onset of adolescence, and also to some extent with the worries and tensions of that period. Stresses that individual differences are normal variants.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Them and us: a case study
results.creator_credit: Technical and Scientific Films, Film Producers Guild, Terrick Fitzhugh and Peter K. Smith
results.brief_description: A large industrial firm is used as a case study to illstrate the need for cooperation and understanding of each other’s needs between management and the representatives of employee groups. Illustrates employee representation in management.

results.title: Theirs is the kingdom
results.brief_description: Two high school boys attempting to solve the problems of poverty in a Mexican border town, cause a near riot because of their insensitivity. Back at school one of the boys realises that the whole venture was no more than an ego trip, and tries to escape his feelings by speeding out to the desert on his bike. The bike upsets and he finds himself in the dust, alone unable to take anymore, he cries out to God. Some days later, Carl at peace, is seen alone heading back to spend a few days living among the people in the border town.

results.title: Their world (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film explores the significance of play as a preparation for life and is an insight into child beahviour and personality. By confonting a selection of children with a “mini world” each child is invited to build his or her world using a vast assortment of tiny props. Hungarian dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Their health is our wealth
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eric Thompson and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: The film shows the various stages of training for degrees in Veterinary Science at the University of Sydney and the University of Brisbane, including academic training and practical training at the University farm. The film also shows aspects of the various fields of work open to graduates (for example private practice with farm animals or pets, research work for government agencies or commercial firms).

results.title: Their first year
results.creator_credit: Eothen Films, Phillip Sattin and Roland Feven
results.brief_description: Advice for mothers on child care during the first year of life. Observes several mothers and babies and gives guidance on such subjects as bathing, breast and bottle feeding, teething, potting, sickness after meals, the “three month colic”, immunization, and hazards in the home. Raises, without trying to resolve, the problem of the psychological impact of a new arrival on older children.
